attributes.action: Scrap the NI Rise, reduce fuel duty now and increase basic rate tax allowances
attributes.additional_details: The Government need to demonstrate that they understand and care about the wider UK population outside of their Westminster bubble. To be looking to increase the tax burden at such a time will pose further risk to the UK economy and push more individuals into real and tangible poverty.
attributes.background: The Government need to scrap the planned NI rise. They should immediately reduce fuel duty and increase the personal allowances for all basic rate taxpayers.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Raise tax free Personal Allowance to £18,570 to help low income people to get by: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597229

Delay the April NI increase given the impact of the fuel crisis on UK households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611326

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

Implement immediate actions to stop the cost of living catastrophe: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611567
